name: GPTizer: Enterprise
title: GPTizer: Enterprise

api_list.name: get_download_link_for_document
api_list.description: This endpoint generates a presigned URL for downloading a specific file, which includes an expiration time. This method ensures secure, temporary access to files stored within the system without exposing the storage backend directly to the user. The presigned URL can be used to directly download the file from the storage service.

required_parameters.name: expiration_seconds
required_parameters.description: Time in seconds for the presigned URL to remain valid

required_parameters.name: item_id
required_parameters.description: Specifies the unique identifier of the file system item (either a file or a folder) that is the target of the operation.

optional_parameters.name: integration_name
optional_parameters.description: This parameter names the integration used for folder creation or management, allowing the system to adjust its behavior. If unspecified, it defaults to a standard setting (DEFAULT_INTEGRATION), ensuring smooth operation and a consistent user experience.

api_list.name: generate_crypto_key
api_list.description: Generate a cryptographic key to use for storing encrypted messages in DynamoDB storage.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://gptizer-enterprise1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/secrets/generate-crypto-key"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "gptizer-enterprise1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

schema.title: Response Generate Crypto Key Api V1 Secrets Generate Crypto Key Get

api_list.name: fetch_messages_from_vector_db
api_list.description: Retrieve a list of messages associated with a specific organization and chat. If the near_text is provided, then the results are sorted by vector distance and sort_order does not have any affect. near_text accepts a text string, which is then converted into a vector representation. It's utilized to search and retrieve messages that have the closest meaning to the provided text. By leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and vector space models, the system efficiently identifies messages with similar semantic content, facilitating more relevant and meaningful search results based on the concept of semantic similarity rather than exact keyword matches. This feature is particularly useful in applications requiring nuanced understanding and retrieval of text data, such as chatbots, helpdesk support, and content management systems.

required_parameters.name: organization_id
required_parameters.description: Specifies the unique identifier for the organization. This ID is crucial for associating the request with the correct organizational account, enabling the system to retrieve, update, or manage data specific to that organization.

required_parameters.name: user_id
required_parameters.description: This parameter identifies the user within the system, facilitating the management of chats and messages associated with that particular user. The user_id is essential for correctly attributing communications to the same entity, ensuring a cohesive and personalized interaction history.

optional_parameters.name: integration_name
optional_parameters.description: This parameter names the integration used for messages creation or management, allowing the system to adjust its behavior. If unspecified, it defaults to a standard setting (DEFAULT_INTEGRATION), ensuring smooth operation and a consistent user experience.

optional_parameters.name: near_text
optional_parameters.description: Near_text is converted to a vector representation of the string and used to find messages with the most close meaning

api_list.name: get_content
api_list.description: This endpoint checks the processing status of AI knowledge content based on its unique identifier. It's designed to verify whether a specific piece of content has already been processed, helping to avoid redundant processing and ensuring efficient management of the knowledge base. This functionality is crucial for systems that handle large volumes of content, enabling streamlined updates and maintenance.

required_parameters.name: schema_name
required_parameters.description: Specifies the name of the Vector DB Schema where the content is stored. This parameter is crucial for getting the processed content from the appropriate schema within the vector database, ensuring that the content is organized and accessible according to the specified data structure.

required_parameters.name: unique_identifier
required_parameters.description: This parameter specifies the unique identifier of the content entity. It serves as a key to uniquely distinguish each piece of content within the system, ensuring that updates, retrievals, and analyses can be accurately associated with the correct content item

optional_parameters.name: integration_name
optional_parameters.description: This parameter names the integration used for content creation or management, allowing the system to adjust its behavior. If unspecified, it defaults to a standard setting (DEFAULT_INTEGRATION), ensuring smooth operation and a consistent user experience.

api_list.name: fetch_chats
api_list.description: This endpoint allows the retrieval of a list of chat sessions that are associated with the organization of the currently authenticated user. It ensures that users can access only the chats relevant to their organization, adhering to data access and privacy policies. This operation is essential for organizational administrators or members to monitor, manage, or analyze chat interactions within their scope.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Sets the starting point for fetching chat records, effectively enabling pagination of the dataset. An offset of 0 begins the query from the first record, while specifying a higher number skips that many records from the beginning. Use this in conjunction with the limit parameter to implement pagination or to navigate through large sets of chat data.

optional_parameters.name: filter_by_agent_help_requested
optional_parameters.description: Determines whether to limit the returned chats to those where agent assistance has been explicitly requested. By default, this is set to True, meaning only chats flagged for agent help will be included in the response. Set this parameter to False if you wish to include all chats regardless of the help request status.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Defines the maximum number of chat records to return in the response. This allows for controlling the size of the data payload and facilitating pagination. The default limit is set to 50, optimizing the balance between response comprehensiveness and performance. Adjust this value based on your data handling needs or UI requirements.

optional_parameters.name: integration_name
optional_parameters.description: Specifies the name of the integration module being queried. This allows the API to filter chats based on the specific integration they're associated with. If not provided, the system will default to using the predefined DEFAULT_INTEGRATION setting, ensuring that queries are always contextualized within an integration framework.

api_list.name: ping

print(response.json())
